issue.headline: Service 0x24: Undefined behavior due to incompatible function pointer call
issue.problemDescription:
What happens (symptoms): ------------------------------------------------------------------- Anything might happen, as behavior is UNDEFINED. Undefined behavior may cause misbehavior anytime, even at unrelated locations.
The DCM casts a pointer to a function to point to a function of a different type and dereferences it. According to the C90 standard, such an operation leads to undefined behavior: "A pointer to a function is converted to point to a function of a different type and used to call a function of a type not compatible with the original type (6.3.4)."
When does this happen: ------------------------------------------------------------------- Each time when a DID with gaps in the signal layout is requested via service 0x24 the wrong cast happens.
In which configuration does this happen: ------------------------------------------------------------------- DCM is configured to support scaling DIDs with gaps: at the beginning: (/Dcm/DcmConfigSet/DcmDsp/DcmDspDid/DcmDspDidSignal/DcmDspDidDataPos[<Signal 0>] != 0) or, anywhere: (DcmDspDidDataPos[<Signal n>] + DcmDspData/DcmDspDataSize [<Signal n>] != DcmDspDidDataPos[<Signal n+1>]) or, any signal is explicitly configured to be a gap: (/Dcm/DcmConfigSet/DcmDsp/DcmDspData/DcmDspDataUsePort == USE_NO_DATA) AND - (/Dcm/DcmConfigSet/DcmDsp/DcmDspDataInfos/DcmDspDataScalingInfoSize > 0)
issue.resolutionDescription:
Workaround: ------------------------------------------------------------------- No workaround available.
Resolution: ------------------------------------------------------------------- The described issue is corrected by modification of all affected work-products.
